ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Acoustic Trauma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of sudden hearing loss, tinnitus, and hyperacusis immediately following a pistol shot, with audiometric findings of a notch at 3000-4000 Hz.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and configuration of loss.
To evaluate speech reception threshold and word recognition ability.
To assess middle ear status and tympanic membrane compliance.
To evaluate the integrity of the reflex arc.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear shows normal hearing sensitivity with a slight high-frequency slope. The left ear exhibits a mild low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss with a moderate notch at 3000-4000 Hz, consistent with acoustic trauma. Speech recognition is excellent in the right ear but reduced (72%) in the left. Tympanometry reveals a hypercompliant system (Type Ad) in the left ear, though acoustic reflexes remain normal.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (250-4000 Hz), slight/mild loss at 6-8 kHz. Left ear: Mild SNHL (250-1500 Hz), slight at 2000 Hz, moderate notch at 3000-4000 Hz, slight/mild at 6000-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 10 dB HL, WRS 100%. Left ear: SRT 33 dB HL, WRS 72% (moderate difficulty).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (Type A). Left ear: Hypercompliant (Type Ad, 2.20 mmho).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal thresholds at 500 through 4000 Hz ipsilaterally and contralaterally.

proposed_items: Hearing aid evaluation for the left ear
Evaluation for management of tinnitus and hyperacusis
Use of hearing protection in noise
counseling_actions: Counsel on the importance of hearing protection to prevent further damage
Review medical clearance and lack of further medical intervention options

escalation.rationale_short: Consultation for unilateral sudden hearing loss and medical clearance for amplification.

expected_outcome: Medical clearance for amplification was provided by the otologist.
No further medical intervention was recommended.
